meanings.definition: A person who tells jokes or plays pranks.
meanings.sent1: The gagsters at the party had everyone laughing with their funny stories.
meanings.sent2: The comedy show was a hit thanks to the talented gagsters on stage.
meanings.sent3: The gagsters decided to prank their friend by hiding fake spiders in his room.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a natural gagster, always coming up with clever jokes.
meanings.sent5: The school talent show featured a variety of talented gagsters showcasing their humor.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who engage in comedic performances.
meanings.sent1: The gagsters rehearsed their skit for the upcoming comedy festival.
meanings.sent2: The improv group was known for their quick wit and hilarious antics as gagsters.
meanings.sent3: The gagsters entertained the audience with their slapstick humor and funny costumes.
meanings.sent4: Being part of a team of gagsters allowed her to explore different styles of comedy.
meanings.sent5: The circus had a talented troupe of gagsters who kept the crowd in stitches with their antics.

meanings.definition: To silence or restrain someone by putting something in their mouth.
meanings.sent1: The kidnappers tried to gag the victim to prevent them from screaming.
meanings.sent2: She had to gagster the noisy parrot by giving it a treat to keep it quiet.
meanings.sent3: He had to gagster his little brother with a candy to stop him from revealing the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to gagster the informant to protect their identity.
meanings.sent5: In the movie, the villain would often gagster their captives to keep them from escaping.
